meanings.definition: relating to the development of an embryo
meanings.sent1: The embryologically important stage is when the cells start to differentiate.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the embryologically significant changes in the early stages of development.
meanings.sent3: The embryologically fascinating process of cell division captivated the students in biology class.
meanings.sent4: The impact of nutrition on the embryologically crucial phase of growth is profound.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used colorful diagrams to explain the embryologically complex concept to the students.

meanings.definition: in a manner related to embryology
meanings.sent1: She observed the cells dividing embryologically under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The research team worked embryologically to understand the genetic factors at play.
meanings.sent3: The scientist humorously described the experiment as proceeding embryologically, step by step.
meanings.sent4: The project progressed embryologically, revealing new insights into developmental processes.
meanings.sent5: The students learned about genetics by observing embryos embryologically in the lab.
